author: Special Correspondent
text:
Not satisfied with the way in which the police had dealt with incidents in September last year when five camels, initially rescued by the police, could not be saved from slaughter eventually, the Madras High Court on Monday directed the Animal Husbandry Department Secretary and the police officer in-charge to appear before it on February 15.

When the plea came up for hearing on Monday, the First Bench comprising Chief Justice S.K. Kaul and Justice M. Sathyanarayanan asked for the affidavit from the State government.

“The affidavit filed today appears to be only an exercise in postponement and nothing more than that,” the court observed. The Bench did not accept the reason given for not filing the minutes of the meeting held on October 19 last year. “The excuse of the floods is not admissible in this case because the minutes ought to have been drawn on October 19 last year itself and the floods affected Chennai only in December last year,” the Bench said.

The Bench said, “We are troubled with the episodes related and recorded in our orders as to how the police handled the situation, as it expressed the helplessness in controlling the situation.”
title: Camel slaughter: officials told to appear in HC on Feb. 15
